Articles.Content:
So I was looking in the persistent.sfs and I saw this:

badS = False

What will happen if you turn that on true? I saw Jebediah with this on True.

Think about it...
Letter S will be bad then. Obvious.
This controls the Jeb Factor, whether he will laugh in the face of danger or not.
It controls the SAS stability module. When BadS = False, SAS only controls torque, when set to true, it unlocks Mechjeb and Hyperedit on every craft
Whatever it is, the vast majority of Kermans has it set to Off. In my save Jeb and two other had it set to on, out of 45 Kermans who are on a mission at this time.

It controls the SAS stability module. When BadS = False, SAS only controls torque, when set to true, it unlocks Mechjeb and Hyperedit on every craft

How does SAS have to do with kerbals?

I think it's basically the couragex 1 billion code.

If you want my honest opinion, I think it will determine whether or not a Kerbal might defect from the commands you give him when you can let Kerbals fly the ships.

I can see it now, you let Jeb fly the ship, and you set up a nice maneuver node for him to burn at, he instead burns in such a way that skims the craft a dozen meters off the Muner surface while flying at 2 km/s.

Edited June 28, 2013 by Themohawkninja
Once I got Chuck Kerman as a random spawn... He was a certified badS!
It controls whether or not they laugh in the face of danger or not.

How does SAS have to do with kerbals?

I think it's basically the couragex 1 billion code.

It interacts with the j.OKE module.
Whoa. I think this is the switch of the end of kerbin.

On a serious note, I beleive that's going to be the flag that determines whether a Kerbal is trained for the mission or not, once that functionality is implemented in the game.

On a not serious note, it's a switch that injects laughing gas into the pilot's spacesuit.
